response_parsed.title: Testing Strategies for WSGI Ref Code with pytest in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer outlines effective testing strategies using pytest for WSGI ref code in Python 3.12 and beyond.
key_points: Leverage pytest's built-in features for testing WSGI applications.
Utilize the `pytest-wsgi` plugin to simplify testing WSGI apps with pytest.
Write test functions following pytest conventions and structure your tests in a test module.
Test individual routes, handler functions, or middleware within your application.
Mock dependencies using pytest's built-in mocking functionality for isolation during testing.
version_notes: Pytest version 7.0 and above is required for using pytest-wsgi.
The examples provided in this explainer use Python 3.12.
caveats: It's essential to structure your test suite in a way that covers all aspects of the WSGI application, including edge cases and different request methods (GET, POST, etc.).
Mocking dependencies can help ensure test isolation and avoid unintended side effects on the actual system.
Remember to install the `pytest-wsgi` plugin using pip: `pip install pytest-wsgi`.
